Navigation
Name Rascal/Libraries/util/Resources/root
Synopsis Retrieve a full hierarchical representation of all resources in the Eclipse workspace.
Function Resource root()
Examples 
rascal>import util::Resources;
ok
rascal>root();
Resource: root({
    project(
      |project://Pacioli|,
      {
        file(|project://Pacioli/.project|),
        folder(
          |project://Pacioli/eclipse|,
          {
            folder(
              |project://Pacioli/eclipse/vis|,
              {
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/vis/Render.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/vis/RenderSWT.rsc|)
              }),
            folder(
              |project://Pacioli/eclipse/util|,
              {
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/Prompt.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/Editors.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/Clipboard.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/ValueUI.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/Resources.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/ParseTreeUI.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/ResourceMarkers.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/IDE.rsc|),
                file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/util/SyntaxHighlightingTemplates.rsc|)
              }),
            folder(
              |project://Pacioli/eclipse/lang|,

                  |project://Pacioli/eclipse/lang/sdf2|,
                  {file(|project://Pacioli/eclipse/lang/sdf2/Plugin.rsc|)}),

                      |project://Pacioli/eclipse/lang/java/jdt|,
